layer.name: VK_LAYER_KHRONOS_profiles
layer.introduction: The Khronos Profiles layer helps test across a wide range of hardware capabilities without requiring a physical copy of every device.

presets.label: Force Physical Device Only
presets.description: Use the Profiles layer to force a specific physical device

presets.label: Emulate a Vulkan Portability Profile
presets.description: Emulate a Vulkan Profile with Vulkan Portability

settings.label: Force Device
settings.description: On system with multiple physical devices, force the use of one specific physical device.

flags.label: Off
flags.description: Let the Vulkan Loader list all the Physical Device.

flags.label: Using Device UUID
flags.description: Force the Physical Device identified by the device UUID.

settings.label: Device UUID
settings.description: Device UUID of the forced physical devices

flags.label: Using Device Name
flags.description: Force the Physical Device identified by the device UUID.

settings.label: Device Name
settings.description: Device Name of the forced physical devices

settings.label: Emulate a Vulkan Profile
settings.description: Emulate a Vulkan Profile on the Developer System

settings.label: Loading Directory
settings.description: Select the location all the profiles.

settings.label: Name
settings.description: Name of the profile specified by the profile file to use.

settings.label: Schema Validation
settings.description: Validate the profile files against the Vulkan SDK profile schema if the file is found.

settings.label: Simulate Profile Capabilities
settings.description: Control of the simulated capabilities of the Vulkan physical device from the selected Vulkan Profile.

flags.label: Version
flags.description: The Vulkan device will report the API version from the selected Profile. It also overrides the `api-version` set in VkPhysicalDeviceProperties.

flags.label: Features
flags.description: The Vulkan device will report the features from the selected Profile.

settings.label: Unspecified Features
settings.description: Feature values when not specified in the select Vulkan profiles.

flags.label: Use Device Values
flags.description: When a feature is not mentionned in the select Vulkan profiles, set is to the physical device value.

flags.label: Use False
flags.description: When a feature is not mentionned in the select Vulkan profiles, set it to false.

flags.label: Properties
flags.description: The Vulkan device will report the properties from the selected Profile.

flags.label: Device Extensions
flags.description: The Vulkan device will report the extensions from the selected Profile.

flags.label: Formats
flags.description: The Vulkan device will report the formats from the selected Profile.

settings.label: Emulate VK_KHR_portability_subset
settings.description: Emulate the VK_KHR_portability_subset extension on the device.

settings.label: constantAlphaColorBlendFactors
settings.description: Indicates whether this implementation supports constant alpha Blend Factors used as source or destination color Blending.

settings.label: events
settings.description: Indicates whether this implementation supports synchronization using Events

settings.label: imageViewFormatReinterpretation
settings.description: Indicates whether this implementation supports a VkImageView being created with a texel format containing a different number of components, or a different number of bits in each component, than the texel format of the underlying VkImage.

settings.label: imageViewFormatSwizzle
settings.description: Indicates whether this implementation supports remapping format components using VkImageViewCreateInfo::components.

settings.label: imageView2DOn3DImage
settings.description: Indicates whether this implementation supports a VkImage being created with the VK_IMAGE_CREATE_2D_ARRAY_COMPATIBLE_BIT flag set, permitting a 2D or 2D array image view to be created on a 3D VkImage.

settings.label: multisampleArrayImage
settings.description: Indicates whether this implementation supports a VkImage being created as a 2D array with multiple samples per texel.

settings.label: mutableComparisonSamplers
settings.description: Indicates whether this implementation allows descriptors with comparison samplers to be updated.

settings.label: pointPolygons
settings.description: Indicates whether this implementation supports Rasterization using a point Polygon Mode.

settings.label: samplerMipLodBias
settings.description: Indicates whether this implementation supports setting a mipmap LOD bias value when creating a sampler.

settings.label: separateStencilMaskRef
settings.description: Indicates whether this implementation supports separate front and back Stencil Test reference values.

settings.label: shaderSampleRateInterpolationFunctions
settings.description: Indicates whether this implementation supports fragment shaders which use the InterpolationFunction capability.

settings.label: tessellationIsolines
settings.description: Indicates whether this implementation supports isoline output from the Tessellation stage of a graphics pipeline. This member is only meaningful if tessellationShader are supported.

settings.label: triangleFans
settings.description: Indicates whether this implementation supports Triangle Fans primitive topology.

settings.label: vertexAttributeAccessBeyondStride
settings.description: Indicates whether this implementation supports accessing a vertex input attribute beyond the stride of the corresponding vertex input binding.

settings.label: minVertexInputBindingStrideAlignment
settings.description: Indicates whether this implementation supports accessing a vertex input attribute beyond the stride of the corresponding vertex input binding.

settings.label: Exclude Device Extensions
settings.description: Removes the listed device extensions from being reported by the Vulkan physical device.

settings.label: Exclude Formats
settings.description: Removes the format feature flags from being reported by the Vulkan physical device.

settings.label: Debug Actions
settings.description: This indicates what action is to be taken when a layer wants to report information

flags.label: Log to OutputDebugString
flags.description: Log messages using the Windows OutputDebugString for Vulkan Studio output display.

settings.label: Log Filename
settings.description: Specifies the output filename

settings.label: Clear Log at Launch
settings.description: Discard the content of the log file between each layer run

flags.label: Break
flags.description: Trigger a breakpoint if a debugger is in use.

settings.label: Fail on Error
settings.description: If the device doesn't support the capabilities of the selected Profile, the layer fail to load. When enabled, vkEnumeratePhysicalDevices will fail when the selected Profile is not supported.

settings.label: Message Types
settings.description: This is a comma-delineated list of options telling the layer what types of messages it should report back

flags.label: Warning
flags.description: Report warnings from using the API in a manner which may lead to undefined behavior or to warn the user of common trouble spots. A warning does NOT necessarily signify illegal application behavior.

flags.label: Debug
flags.description: Report debug information for the Profiles Layer development.
